alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 6:49PM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate snow and gusty winds possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with higher amounts of 9 inches or more possible in the backcountry above pass level. Winds could gust as high as 30 MPH in the valleys and 45 MPH near mountain peaks. * WHERE...The Bear Lake Valley, eastern highlands, Big Hole Mountains, Teton Valley, Centennial Mountains, and Island Park region, including but not limited to Border Summit, Geneva Summit, Montpelier, Georgetown, Georgetown Summit, Swan Valley, Pine Creek Pass, Victor, Driggs, Ashton, Island Park, Raynolds Pass, and Targhee Pass. * WHEN...From late Tuesday morning through late Wednesday morning. The worst conditions are expected late Tuesday afternoon into early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The combination of moderate snowfall rates and gusty winds could make travel difficult, including for the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. Blowing and drifting snow could significantly reduce visibility and make it harder than usual for transportation crews to keep roads clear.
info.instruction: Closely monitor the latest forecasts, watches, warnings, and advisories from the National Weather Service in Pocatello for updates on this developing situation.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley
